speaker: TOBY
text: Approach, Sir Andrew. Not to be abed after

speaker: TOBY
text: midnight is to be up betimes, and “diluculo surgere,”

speaker: TOBY
text: thou know’st—

speaker: ANDREW
text: Nay, by my troth, I know not. But I know to

speaker: ANDREW
text: be up late is to be up late.

speaker: TOBY
text: A false conclusion. I hate it as an unfilled can. To

speaker: TOBY
text: be up after midnight and to go to bed then, is early,

speaker: TOBY
text: so that to go to bed after midnight is to go to bed

speaker: TOBY
text: betimes. Does not our lives consist of the four

speaker: TOBY
text: elements?

speaker: ANDREW
text: Faith, so they say, but I think it rather consists

speaker: ANDREW
text: of eating and drinking.

speaker: TOBY
text: Thou ’rt a scholar. Let us therefore eat and

speaker: TOBY
text: drink. Marian, I say, a stoup of wine!

speaker: ANDREW
text: Here comes the Fool, i’ faith.

speaker: FOOL
text: How now, my hearts? Did you never see the

speaker: FOOL
text: picture of “We Three”?

speaker: TOBY
text: Welcome, ass! Now let’s have a catch.

speaker: ANDREW
text: By my troth, the Fool has an excellent breast.

speaker: ANDREW
text: I had rather than forty shillings I had such a leg,

speaker: ANDREW
text: and so sweet a breath to sing, as the Fool has.—In

speaker: ANDREW
text: sooth, thou wast in very gracious fooling last night

speaker: ANDREW
text: when thou spok’st of Pigrogromitus of the Vapians

speaker: ANDREW
text: passing the equinoctial of Queubus. ’Twas very

speaker: ANDREW
text: good, i’ faith. I sent thee sixpence for thy leman.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Hadst it?

speaker: FOOL
text: I did impeticos thy gratillity, for Malvolio’s nose

speaker: FOOL
text: is no whipstock, my lady has a white hand, and the

speaker: FOOL
text: Myrmidons are no bottle-ale houses.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Excellent! Why, this is the best fooling when

speaker: ANDREW
text: all is done. Now, a song!

speaker: TOBY
text: Come on, there is

speaker: TOBY
text: sixpence for you. Let’s have a song.

speaker: ANDREW
text: There’s a testril of

speaker: ANDREW
text: me, too. If one knight give a—

speaker: FOOL
text: Would you have a love song or a song of good

speaker: FOOL
text: life?

speaker: TOBY
text: A love song, a love song.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Ay, ay, I care not for good life.

speaker: FOOL
text:
FOOL
            
            
               
              sings
            
            
              
                O
                 
                mistress
                 
                mine
                ,
                 
                where
                 
                are
                 
                you
                 
                roaming
                ?
              
              
                O
                ,
                 
                stay
                 
                and
                 
                hear
                !
                 
                Your
                 
                truelove’s
                 
                coming
                ,
              
              
                That
                 
                can
                 
                sing
                 
                both
                 
                high
                 
                and
                 
                low
                .
              
              
                Trip
                 
                no
                 
                further
                ,
                 
                pretty
                 
                sweeting
                .
              
              
                Journeys
                 
                end
                 
                in
                 
                lovers
                 
                meeting
                ,
              
              
                Every
                 
                wise
                 
                man’s
                 
                son
                 
                doth
                 
                know
                .

speaker: ANDREW
text: Excellent good, i’ faith!

speaker: TOBY
text: Good, good.

speaker: FOOL
text:
FOOL
            
            
               
              sings
            
            
              
                What
                 
                is
                 
                love
                ?
                 
                ’Tis
                 
                not
                 
                hereafter
                .
              
              
                Present
                 
                mirth
                 
                hath
                 
                present
                 
                laughter
                .
              
              
                What’s
                 
                to
                 
                come
                 
                is
                 
                still
                 
                unsure
                .
              
              
                In
                 
                delay
                 
                there
                 
                lies
                 
                no
                 
                plenty
                ,
              
              
                Then
                 
                come
                 
                kiss
                 
                me
                ,
                 
                sweet
                 
                and
                 
                twenty
                .
              
              
                Youth’s
                 
                a
                 
                stuff
                 
                will
                 
                not
                 
                endure
                .

speaker: ANDREW
text: A mellifluous voice, as I am true knight.

speaker: TOBY
text: A contagious breath.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Very sweet and contagious, i’ faith.

speaker: TOBY
text: To hear by the nose, it is dulcet in contagion.

speaker: TOBY
text: But shall we make the welkin dance indeed? Shall

speaker: TOBY
text: we rouse the night owl in a catch that will draw

speaker: TOBY
text: three souls out of one weaver? Shall we do that?

speaker: ANDREW
text: An you love me, let’s do ’t. I am dog at a

speaker: ANDREW
text: catch.

speaker: FOOL
text: By ’r Lady, sir, and some dogs will catch well.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Most certain. Let our catch be “Thou

speaker: ANDREW
text: Knave.”

speaker: FOOL
text: “Hold thy peace, thou knave,” knight? I shall be

speaker: FOOL
text: constrained in ’t to call thee “knave,” knight.

speaker: ANDREW
text: ’Tis not the first time I have constrained one

speaker: ANDREW
text: to call me “knave.” Begin, Fool. It begins “Hold

speaker: ANDREW
text: thy peace.”

speaker: FOOL
text: I shall never begin if I hold my peace.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Good, i’ faith. Come, begin.

speaker: MARIA
text: What a caterwauling do you keep here! If my

speaker: MARIA
text: lady have not called up her steward Malvolio and

speaker: MARIA
text: bid him turn you out of doors, never trust me.

speaker: TOBY
text: My lady’s a Cataian, we are politicians, Malvolio’s

speaker: TOBY
text:
a Peg-a-Ramsey, and 
                Sings
                .
               Three merry men be

speaker: TOBY
text: we. Am not I consanguineous? Am I not of her

speaker: TOBY
text:
blood? Tillyvally! “Lady”!
                 
                Sings
                .
               There dwelt a man

speaker: TOBY
text: in Babylon, lady, lady.

speaker: FOOL
text: Beshrew me, the knight’s in admirable fooling.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Ay, he does well enough if he be disposed,

speaker: ANDREW
text: and so do I, too. He does it with a better grace, but

speaker: ANDREW
text: I do it more natural.

speaker: TOBY
text: O’ the twelfth day of December—

speaker: MARIA
text: For the love o’ God, peace!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: My masters, are you mad? Or what are you?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Have you no wit, manners, nor honesty but to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: gabble like tinkers at this time of night? Do you

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: make an ale-house of my lady’s house, that you

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: squeak out your coziers’ catches without any mitigation

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: or remorse of voice? Is there no respect of

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: place, persons, nor time in you?

speaker: TOBY
text: We did keep time, sir, in our catches. Sneck up!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Sir Toby, I must be round with you. My lady

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: bade me tell you that, though she harbors you as her

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: kinsman, she’s nothing allied to your disorders. If

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: you can separate yourself and your misdemeanors,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: you are welcome to the house; if not, an it would

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: please you to take leave of her, she is very willing to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: bid you farewell.

speaker: TOBY
text: Farewell, dear heart, since I must needs be gone.

speaker: MARIA
text: Nay, good Sir Toby.

speaker: FOOL
text: His eyes do show his days are almost done.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Is ’t even so?

speaker: TOBY
text: But I will never die.

speaker: FOOL
text: Sir Toby, there you lie.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: This is much credit to you.

speaker: TOBY
text: Shall I bid him go?

speaker: FOOL
text: What an if you do?

speaker: TOBY
text: Shall I bid him go, and spare not?

speaker: FOOL
text: O no, no, no, no, you dare not.

speaker: TOBY
text: Out o’ tune, sir? You lie. Art any more than a

speaker: TOBY
text: steward? Dost thou think, because thou art virtuous,

speaker: TOBY
text: there shall be no more cakes and ale?

speaker: FOOL
text: Yes, by Saint Anne, and ginger shall be hot i’ th’

speaker: FOOL
text: mouth, too.

speaker: TOBY
text: Thou ’rt i’ th’ right.—Go, sir, rub your chain

speaker: TOBY
text: with crumbs.—A stoup of wine, Maria!

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: Mistress Mary, if you prized my lady’s favor

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: at anything more than contempt, you would not give

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: means for this uncivil rule. She shall know of it, by

speaker: MALVOLIO
text: this hand.

speaker: MARIA
text: Go shake your ears!

speaker: ANDREW
text: ’Twere as good a deed as to drink when a

speaker: ANDREW
text: man’s a-hungry, to challenge him the field and

speaker: ANDREW
text: then to break promise with him and make a fool of

speaker: ANDREW
text: him.

speaker: TOBY
text: Do ’t, knight. I’ll write thee a challenge. Or I’ll

speaker: TOBY
text: deliver thy indignation to him by word of mouth.

speaker: MARIA
text: Sweet Sir Toby, be patient for tonight. Since the

speaker: MARIA
text: youth of the Count’s was today with my lady, she is

speaker: MARIA
text: much out of quiet. For Monsieur Malvolio, let me

speaker: MARIA
text: alone with him. If I do not gull him into a nayword

speaker: MARIA
text: and make him a common recreation, do not think I

speaker: MARIA
text: have wit enough to lie straight in my bed. I know I

speaker: MARIA
text: can do it.

speaker: TOBY
text: Possess us, possess us, tell us something of him.

speaker: MARIA
text: Marry, sir, sometimes he is a kind of puritan.

speaker: ANDREW
text: O, if I thought that, I’d beat him like a dog!

speaker: TOBY
text: What, for being a puritan? Thy exquisite reason,

speaker: TOBY
text: dear knight?

speaker: ANDREW
text: I have no exquisite reason for ’t, but I have

speaker: ANDREW
text: reason good enough.

speaker: MARIA
text: The devil a puritan that he is, or anything

speaker: MARIA
text: constantly but a time-pleaser; an affectioned ass

speaker: MARIA
text: that cons state without book and utters it by great

speaker: MARIA
text: swaths; the best persuaded of himself, so crammed,

speaker: MARIA
text: as he thinks, with excellencies, that it is his grounds

speaker: MARIA
text: of faith that all that look on him love him. And on

speaker: MARIA
text: that vice in him will my revenge find notable cause

speaker: MARIA
text: to work.

speaker: TOBY
text: What wilt thou do?

speaker: MARIA
text: I will drop in his way some obscure epistles of

speaker: MARIA
text: love, wherein by the color of his beard, the shape of

speaker: MARIA
text: his leg, the manner of his gait, the expressure of his

speaker: MARIA
text: eye, forehead, and complexion, he shall find himself

speaker: MARIA
text: most feelingly personated. I can write very like my

speaker: MARIA
text: lady your niece; on a forgotten matter, we can

speaker: MARIA
text: hardly make distinction of our hands.

speaker: TOBY
text: Excellent! I smell a device.

speaker: ANDREW
text: I have ’t in my nose, too.

speaker: TOBY
text: He shall think, by the letters that thou wilt drop,

speaker: TOBY
text: that they come from my niece, and that she’s in

speaker: TOBY
text: love with him.

speaker: MARIA
text: My purpose is indeed a horse of that color.

speaker: ANDREW
text: And your horse now would make him an ass.

speaker: MARIA
text: Ass, I doubt not.

speaker: ANDREW
text: O, ’twill be admirable!

speaker: MARIA
text: Sport royal, I warrant you. I know my physic

speaker: MARIA
text: will work with him. I will plant you two, and let the

speaker: MARIA
text: Fool make a third, where he shall find the letter.

speaker: MARIA
text: Observe his construction of it. For this night, to bed,

speaker: MARIA
text: and dream on the event. Farewell.

speaker: TOBY
text: Good night, Penthesilea.

speaker: ANDREW
text: Before me, she’s a good wench.

speaker: TOBY
text: She’s a beagle true bred, and one that adores

speaker: TOBY
text: me. What o’ that?

speaker: ANDREW
text: I was adored once, too.

speaker: TOBY
text: Let’s to bed, knight. Thou hadst need send for

speaker: TOBY
text: more money.

speaker: ANDREW
text: If I cannot recover your niece, I am a foul way

speaker: ANDREW
text: out.

speaker: TOBY
text: Send for money, knight. If thou hast her not i’

speaker: TOBY
text: th’ end, call me “Cut.”

speaker: ANDREW
text: If I do not, never trust me, take it how you

speaker: ANDREW
text: will.

speaker: TOBY
text: Come, come, I’ll go burn some sack. ’Tis too

speaker: TOBY
text: late to go to bed now. Come, knight; come, knight.
